headline: Gavin Newsom Has an $18 Billion Plan to Shore Up California’s Utilities. It Isn’t Enough.
summary: Investors are concerned that liability claims over wildfires someday might sink California’s two biggest electric utilities,  PG&E  and  Edison International  Until there is a credible financial backstop in place for the companies, they are right to worry.  Electric utilities are supposed to be boring.  Shares of PG&E and Edison are down 24% and 31%, respectively, so far this year, putting them among the S&P 500’s worst performers.

Electric utilities are supposed to be boring.  Shares of PG&E and Edison are down 24% and 31%, respectively, so far this year, putting them among the S&P 500’s worst performers.

headline: US sues Southern California Edison, blames it for Eaton, Fairview wildfires
summary: (Reuters) -The U.S. government filed two lawsuits against Southern California Edison on Thursday, blaming the utility's equipment for sparking two wildfires, including the Eaton Fire in January that damaged National Forest System lands.  The lawsuits against the unit of Edison International were filed by the U.S. Department of Justice in Los Angeles federal court.  They seek more than $77 million in damages for the utility's alleged negligence, trespass by fire and violations of California public safety laws in causing the Eaton Fire and the September 2022 Fairview Fire.
